intro: Stylidium carnosum, commonly known as the мясистый стилидий, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred petals that resemble a spur. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Stylidium carnosum is a short-lived perennial, often producing a single flower per stem.
